meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a clique.
meanings.sent1: The group of friends at school was very cliquey, always sticking together.
meanings.sent2: She found the cliquey behavior of the club members off-putting.
meanings.sent3: The cliquey nature of the book club made it hard for new members to join in.
meanings.sent4: The workplace felt cliquey, like different departments were part of secret societies.
meanings.sent5: The cliquey atmosphere in the gym class made it challenging for shy students to participate.

meanings.sent1: The cliquey students only allowed certain classmates to sit with them at lunch.
meanings.sent2: The exclusive club had a cliquey attitude, making it hard for outsiders to join.
meanings.sent3: The cliquey behavior of the cats in the neighborhood was both amusing and frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The cliquey clouds in the sky seemed to gather together, leaving other areas clear.
meanings.sent5: The cliquey plants in the garden grew closely together, creating a barrier for other flowers to thrive.
